meanings.definition: Remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The elephant had a prodigious size compared to the other animals in the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper was a prodigious structure that dominated the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The prodigious cake was so big that it took three people to carry it.
meanings.sent4: Her prodigious talent in painting left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The storm unleashed a prodigious amount of rain, causing flooding in the streets.

meanings.definition: Extraordinary in bulk, quantity, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested a prodigious amount of corn this season.
meanings.sent2: The company made a prodigious profit this quarter.
meanings.sent3: The prodigious pile of laundry seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: His appetite was prodigious, he could eat a whole pizza by himself.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner showed prodigious stamina as he crossed the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The magician performed a prodigious trick that left the audience in wonder.
meanings.sent2: The singer had a prodigious voice that captivated everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The prodigious sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: Her prodigious memory allowed her to remember every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's prodigious discovery of a hidden cave amazed the scientific community.
